Accessors.VaultAccessor
 
AnnotationBeanReader
 
AnnotationVaultFactoryBuildInfo
A class that reads the BeanWire marking information of the class marked with BeanArea and returns the BuildInfo method.

Thrown InvalidAnnotationConfigClassException if an unmarked BeanArea parameter is passed to the constructor.
Bean
 
Bean.Builder<S extends Bean>
 
BeanArea
Meta-information used when creating a VaultFactoryBuildInfo using a class.
BeanBuilderFactory
 
BeanCycledException
Thrown when, a cycle occurs between beans in the process of creating beans.
BeanLoader
 
BeanLocation
Interface that returns the package path where Bean is located.

In the getPackages() method, type the package path of the beans to scanned,
and in getExcludePackages() method, type the package path of the bin to exclude from Scan.

When specifying a package path, the .* expression is available, and if the .* expression is attached to the end of the package path,
all Beans are scanned up or excluded to the leaf directory of the child package path that contains the package path.

If .* expression is not used, import Bean contained in that folder.
BeanReader
 
BeanWire
Meta-information used in the class marked with BeanArea
This information is read from the AnnotationVaultFactoryBuildInfo class,
and classes that will become InternalBean are found.
ClassVault
Receive the Class type as a parameter and returns the corresponding instance.
ClassVaultFactory
receives VaultFactoryBuildInfo or String (the name of the Vault if the Vault already exists) value as an input,
and returns ClassVault.
DefaultBeanLoader
 
DisallowedAccessPackageException
Thrown when, a package that is not included in @InternalBean's accesses tries to receive bean injection,
or when a package that is not included in Vault's accesses is passed as a parameter of the Vault.
DuplicateBeanNameException
Thrown when, a bean with the same name exists within one vault scope.
DuplicateInjectConstructorException
Thrown when, a class has more than two constructor that marked @Inject annotation
Inject
Annotation to inject the corresponding Bean.
Here is two ways to inject Bean.

FIRST.
InternalBean
An annotation that registers the object as Bean in Vault.

Below are the default settings of InternalBean.
InvalidAnnotationConfigClassException
Throw when, trying to define beans with BeansArea annotation,
if the class is not marked with BeansArea annotation.
NewBean
 
NoDefinedInternalBeanException
Thrown when, the Bean with the name corresponding to the value() of the @Inject annotation does not exist.
PackageReader
 
PropertiesVaultFactoryBuildInfo
Receive the path of *.properties file and specify the return value of the VaultFactoryBuildInfo methods.
Reflection
 
SingletonBean
 
Type
Enum that determines the behavior of Bean.
Vault<P>
As a bean container, containing scanned Bean.
Vault.Builder<S>
 
VaultFactory<T extends Vault<?>>
Receives the VaultFactoryBuildInfo or String (the name of the Vault if the Vault already exists) value as an input, and returns the Vault.
VaultFactoryBuildInfo
One of the parameters that VaultFactory receives.
VaultType
